title: Tram derails in Melbourne: Kew collision impacts homeowners
text:
A tram has been smashed off the tracks in Melbourne, narrowly missing a woman who was standing in her front yard.

A tram has derailed and smashed through a fence in the Melbourne suburb of Kew today after it was hit by a car.

The tram, travelling on Cotham Road at Kew shortly before midday, was carrying more than 20 passengers. A number of passengers had to be taken to hospital with a range of injuries, but none are believed to be serious.

Tow truck has arrived to remove the wrecked car... Cotham rd will remain closed here for several hours as emergency crews investigate and then remove the derailed tram.. ⁦@7NewsMelbourne⁩ pic.twitter.com/0m6Srema6q — Kristy Mayr (@KristyMayr7) October 6, 2019

The vehicle that struck the tram was left with significant front and rear end damage and its occupants had to be cut free.

Yarra Trams has advised commuters travelling through Melbourne’s eastern suburbs to consider other options.

Nine News reports several passengers fell on top of each other when the tram derailed and a baby landed on shattered glass.

More to come
description: A tram has derailed and smashed through a fence in the Melbourne suburb of Kew today after it was hit by a car.
